item.title: 21 Year Olds Don't Want to Change Their Age
item.description: 21 Year Olds Don’t Want to Change Their Age When people were asked, the only demographic that didn’t want to change their age were 21 year olds.

item.title: Face-Name Matching Effect
item.description: Face-Name Matching Effect People chose Dan, the correct answer, 40% of the time rather than 25% of the time (1 out of 4 options).

item.title: The Average Person Wants to Stay 36 Years Old
item.description: The Average Person Wants to Stay 36 Years Old

item.title: You're Considered Old Once You Turn 73.7, According to National Geriatrics
item.description: You’re Considered Old Once You Turn 73.7, According to National Geriatrics That is the average age when people think one is considered old.

item.title: Did People Used To Look Older? - YouTube
item.description: Did People Used To Look Older? - YouTube We Actually Are Aging Slower Advances in healthcare, [[Sunscreen]], and Orthodontics The changes in “old” ages and “new” ages 60 became 56 40 became 37.
